query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 O Simon mago, o miseri seguaci 2 che le cose di Dio, che di bontate 3 deon essere spose, e voi rapaci
4 per oro e per argento avolterate, 5 or convien che per voi suoni la tromba, 6 però che ne la terza bolgia state.
query.result:
**English:**
1 O Simon Magus, O wretched followers, 2 who appropriate the things of God, which ought to be brides of goodness, 3 and you, plunderers,
4 pervert them for gold and silver. 5 Now it is right that the trumpet should sound for you, 6 because you are in the third chasm.
**Cornish:**
1 O Simon Magus, o fylghoryon anvoes, 2 a wra dhe bennath Duw, a dhrehevyans, 3 dhe vos spousyow, ha'gas why agasoryon,
4 rag argant hag arghans a wra'gas kemmyn, 5 mes ow reydh dhe'gas trombon a sonya, 6 rag y'gas yn tresves bolgia ow pesya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Già eravamo, a la seguente tomba, 8 montati de lo scoglio in quella parte 9 ch’a punto sovra mezzo ’l fosso piomba.
query.result:
**English:**
7 We had already climbed down to the next tomb, 8 from the cliff on that side 9 which falls plumb over the middle of the ditch.
**Cornish:**
7 Nyns o ni, dhe'n tombensiwyes, 8 a'gas pandra dhe'n kleudh dhe'n rann na, 9 a wra yn poynt a-ugh dhe gres fos ow komba.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 O somma sapïenza, quanta è l’arte 11 che mostri in cielo, in terra e nel mal mondo, 12 e quanto giusto tua virtù comparte!
13 Io vidi per le coste e per lo fondo 14 piena la pietra livida di fóri, 15 d’un largo tutti e ciascun era tondo.
query.result:
**English:**
10 O supreme wisdom, how great is the art 11 that you show in heaven, on earth, and in the evil world, 12 and how justly your power is shared!
13 I saw the livid stone along the sides and at the bottom 14 full of holes, 15 each one of them wide and round.
**Cornish:**
10 O anfurvyes anfurvus, pyth yw an art 11 a wra'gas diskwedhes yn y'n nef, yn nor ha'gas bys anvoes, 12 ha pyth yw jyst aga'gas nerth a wra rannys!
13 Y'm gwelas a-hedh an costow ha'gas an fond 14 an men liwydh leun a foryow, 15 pub onan ledan ha pub onan rond.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Fuor de la bocca a ciascun soperchiava 23 d’un peccator li piedi e de le gambe 24 infino al grosso, e l’altro dentro stava.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Outside the mouth of each one projected 23 the feet and legs of a sinner 24 as far as the calf, and the rest of him was inside.
**Cornish:**
22 Mes a'gas an kov dhe pub onan o wra ow sevel 23 tramor dhe bechator an treys ha'gas eskern 24 bys dhe'n gros, ha'gas remenans o wra ow tos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Le piante erano a tutti accese intrambe; 26 per che sì forte guizzavan le giunte, 27 che spezzate averien ritorte e strambe.
query.result:
**English:**
25 The soles of their feet were all on fire; 26 because of which their joints twitched so violently 27 that they would have broken twisted and knotted ropes.
**Cornish:**
25 An plant o wra dhe bub onan ow tanow bys yn keffrys; 26 rag henna o wra'gas kesunyow ow gwaynya moy kreff, 27 bys dhe vons o wra ow torras gordhyansow ha stram.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Qual suole il fiammeggiar de le cose unte 29 muoversi pur su per la strema buccia, 30 tal era lì dai calcagni a le punte.
query.result:
**English:**
28 As the flickering of oily things is wont 29 to move only over the outermost surface, 30 so it was there from their heels to their toes.
**Cornish:**
28 Dell yw an flamhegyans a'gas traow untys 29 dhe gwaynya pur a-ugh a-ugh an skorren ughella, 30 dell o wra ena dhe'n halsegow dhe'n poyntys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 «Chi è colui, maestro, che si cruccia 32 guizzando più che li altri suoi consorti», 33 diss’ io, «e cui più roggia fiamma succia?».
query.result:
**English:**
31 "Who is that one, master, who writhes 32 twitching more than his other companions," 33 I said, "and who sucks up a redder flame?"
**Cornish:**
31 "Pyw yw henna, mester, a wra ow kryjya 32 ow gwaynya moy ages y remenans erel," 33 y'm lavar, "ha pyw yw ow sugya flam moy rudh?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Ed elli a me: «Se tu vuo’ ch’i’ ti porti 35 là giù per quella ripa che più giace, 36 da lui saprai di sé e de’ suoi torti».
query.result:
**English:**
34 And he said to me: "If you want me to carry you 35 down there to that bank which lies lower, 36 from him you will learn about himself and his wrongs".
**Cornish:**
34 Ha henna dhymm: "Mas te wellys vyth portha 35 allá dhegys dhe'n fordh na wra dhe'n nessa, 36 dhe henna ty a wra gonnans a-droytho ha'y gamm".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 E io: «Tanto m’è bel, quanto a te piace: 38 tu se’ segnore, e sai ch’i’ non mi parto 39 dal tuo volere, e sai quel che si tace».
query.result:
**English:**
37 And I: "It pleases me as much as it pleases you: 38 you are the master, and you know that I do not depart 39 from your will, and you know what is left unsaid".
**Cornish:**
37 Ha henna vy: "Kemmys yw genen vyth, kepar ha kar dhe'th: 38 why a'th an argluydh, ha ty a wydh na wra vy 39 a'th voladow, ha ty a wydh an peth na wra leverys".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Allor venimmo in su l’argine quarto; 41 volgemmo e discendemmo a mano stanca 42 là giù nel fondo foracchiato e arto.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Then we came to the fourth bank; 41 we turned and descended on the left-hand side 42 down there to the bottom, pierced and narrow.
**Cornish:**
40 Pan wosa ni dhe'n peswora fordh; 41 ni a droas ha a diskennas war-tu klew 42 allá dhegys dhe'n nessa, tryllys ha kunnek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Lo buon maestro ancor de la sua anca 44 non mi dipuose, sì mi giunse al rotto 45 di quel che si piangeva con la zanca.
query.result:
**English:**
43 The good master still did not set me down from his hip, 44 so he brought me to the edge 45 of that which was bewailed with the leg.
**Cornish:**
43 An mester da vyth efan dhe'y eskern 44 na'm a rosav, kepar ha'm a dheuth dhe'n fordh 45 a'n peth a veu bewys gans an eskern.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 «O qual che se’ che ’l di sù tien di sotto, 47 anima trista come pal commessa», 48 comincia’ io a dir, «se puoi, fa motto».
query.result:
**English:**
46 "Oh you who are turned upside down, 47 wretched soul like straw twisted", 48 I began to say, "if you can, speak".
**Cornish:**
46 "O peth eus eus ow tos a-ugh, 47 eneval trist kepar pal kommys", 48 a dhallathas vy a leverel, "mas te a alla".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Io stava come ’l frate che confessa 50 lo perfido assessin, che, poi ch’è fitto, 51 richiama lui per che la morte cessa.
query.result:
**English:**
49 I stood like the friar who hears the confession 50 of the treacherous assassin, who, after he is stabbed, 51 calls out to him so that death may cease.
**Cornish:**
49 Vy a veu kepar an broder a gonfessa 50 an leser torfys, neb, wosa'n veu skethens, 51 a lever orth dhe'y bennak rag an marow a wra skonchyas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Ed el gridò: «Se’ tu già costì ritto, 53 se’ tu già costì ritto, Bonifazio? 54 Di parecchi anni mi mentì lo scritto.
query.result:
**English:**
52 And he cried out: "Are you already standing there, 53 are you already standing there, Boniface? 54 The writing lied to me by several years.
**Cornish:**
52 Ha henna a leveris: "Eus eus ow tos a-ugh, 53 eus eus ow tos a-ugh, Bonifaz? 54 An skrif a'm a wrug gans lies blydhen".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Se’ tu sì tosto di quell’ aver sazio 56 per lo qual non temesti tòrre a ’nganno 57 la bella donna, e poi di farne strazio?».
query.result:
**English:**
55 Are you already sated with that wealth 56 for which you did not fear to take by deceit 57 the beautiful lady, and then to make a spectacle of her?
**Cornish:**
55 Eus eus ow sodhys a'n golon hynnow 56 rag an peth na veu ov owth dhe'th gorra 57 an venen vrav, ha wosa henna dhe'y gwruthylla?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Tal mi fec’ io, quai son color che stanno, 59 per non intender ciò ch’è lor risposto, 60 quasi scornati, e risponder non sanno.
query.result:
**English:**
58 Thus I made myself, like those who stand, 59 not understanding what is answered to them, 60 almost scorned, and they do not know how to answer.
**Cornish:**
58 Kepar hynnow vy a wrug, kepar an re beu, 59 rag na vos ow komprehendya an peth a veu leverys dhe'th, 60 kepar re beu owth owth skornys, ha na won gowsya leverel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Allor Virgilio disse: «Dilli tosto: 62 “Non son colui, non son colui che credi”»; 63 e io rispuosi come a me fu imposto.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Then Virgil said: "Tell him quickly: 62 'I am not the one, I am not the one you think I am'"; 63 and I answered as I was instructed.
**Cornish:**
61 Pan leveris Virgili: "Lever dhe'th bys vyth: 62 'Vy na'n eus an neb, vy na'n eus an neb a grys tys' "; 63 ha vy a leveris kepar ha veu gorrys dhe'm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Per che lo spirto tutti storse i piedi; 65 poi, sospirando e con voce di pianto, 66 mi disse: «Dunque che a me richiedi?
67 Se di saper ch’i’ sia ti cal cotanto, 68 che tu abbi però la ripa corsa, 69 sappi ch’i’ fui vestito del gran manto;
70 e veramente fui figliuol de l’orsa, 71 cupido sì per avanzar li orsatti, 72 che sù l’avere e qui me misi in borsa.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Because of which the spirit twisted all its feet; 65 then, sighing and with a voice of weeping, 66 it said to me: "So what do you ask of me?
67 If you are so keen to know who I am, 68 that you have therefore run the bank, 69 know that I was clothed in the great mantle;
70 and truly I was the son of the bear, 71 so eager to surpass the bear cubs, 72 that I put money and myself in my purse up there.
**Cornish:**
64 Rag an spyrys oll storras y treys; 65 wosa, yn syghya ha gans leun a wela, 66 ev a leveris dhym: "Mebyon pyth a vynnis?
67 Mes es te a vynnis gwybos pyth eus, 68 wosa te a wra hwans an fordh, 69 gwybos ow kov o'm wiska an mantell brassa;
70 ha gwir vythav o'm mab an ors, 71 kovlus rag tremena an orsow, 72 wosa ow posya an argans ha dhym yn-mes an borsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Di sotto al capo mio son li altri tratti 74 che precedetter me simoneggiando, 75 per le fessure de la pietra piatti.
query.result:
**English:**
73 Beneath my head are dragged the others 74 who preceded me, flattering, 75 through the fissures of the flat stone.
**Cornish:**
73 Y'n-dann dhe'm benn yma's an erel vyth treghys 74 a dheuth genesym ow simonegya, 75 dre woles an garrek platt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Là giù cascherò io altresì quando 77 verrà colui ch’i’ credea che tu fossi, 78 allor ch’i’ feci ’l sùbito dimando.
query.result:
**English:**
76 There below I too shall fall when 77 he comes whom I thought you were, 78 then when I made the sudden demand.
**Cornish:**
76 Honna'm kyllyf vy dhe'nwedh pan 77 a dheu an neb a greesem bos te, 78 pan wresa ow kov an govyn diworth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Ma più è ’l tempo già che i piè mi cossi 80 e ch’i’ son stato così sottosopra, 81 ch’el non starà piantato coi piè rossi:
82 ché dopo lui verrà di più laida opra, 83 di ver’ ponente, un pastor sanza legge, 84 tal che convien che lui e me ricuopra.
query.result:
**English:**
79 But the time is already longer that I have roasted my feet 80 and that I have been so upside down, 81 that he will not stand planted with red feet:
82 for after him will come a deed of greater shame, 83 from the true west, a shepherd without law, 84 such that he and I must be covered by it.
**Cornish:**
79 Mes moy yw an termyn a-lemmyn ow kov ow treys ow posya 80 ha ow kov ow bos marow bys y'n-dann, 81 na vo henna bos plantis gans treys rudh:
82 rag wosa henna a dheu ober moy lagas, 83 a-dhyworth an gwir west, mester heb lagha, 84 marow bys ow kov ha henna a wra kovris.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Nuovo Iasón sarà, di cui si legge 86 ne’ Maccabei; e come a quel fu molle 87 suo re, così fia lui chi Francia regge».
query.result:
**English:**
85 He will be a new Jason, of whom one reads 86 in Maccabees; and as his brother-in-law was soft 87 towards him, so will be he who rules France.
**Cornish:**
85 Ev a wra Iasón nowydh, neb a leverir 86 yn Maccabei; ha kepar ha'y froder-yn-lagha 87 o'n veu moy dheudhek, marow bys henna a wra an neb a lever Frannk.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Io non so s’i’ mi fui qui troppo folle, 89 ch’i’ pur rispuosi lui a questo metro: 90 «Deh, or mi dì: quanto tesoro volle
91 Nostro Segnore in prima da san Pietro 92 ch’ei ponesse le chiavi in sua balìa? 93 Certo non chiese se non “Viemmi retro”.
query.result:
**English:**
88 I do not know if I was too mad here, 89 for I did indeed reply to him in this metre: 90 "Ah, now tell me: how much treasure did
91 Our Lord first demand of Saint Peter 92 before he placed the keys in his power? 93 Certainly he asked nothing other than "Follow me".
**Cornish:**
88 Ny wodhav vy es o'm re beuys fol, 89 rag ow a leveris dhodho yn an mesur ma: 90 "A, lemmyn lever dhym: pyth a vynnis
91 An Arluth Nyns yn kynsa gans Sen Peder 92 kyns ev a ros an allwedhow yn y gila? 93 Mes na vynnis henna marnas "Dewgh vy".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Né Pier né li altri tolsero a Matia 95 oro od argento, quando fu sortito 96 al loco che perdé l’anima ria.
query.result:
**English:**
94 Neither Peter nor the others took from Matthias 95 gold or silver, when he was chosen 96 for the place that the wicked soul lost.
**Cornish:**
94 Pier na an erel a gemeras dhe Matia 95 our na arghans, pan vo ev sortys 96 dhe'n le a gollas an eneval ria.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Però ti sta, ché tu se’ ben punito; 98 e guarda ben la mal tolta moneta 99 ch’esser ti fece contra Carlo ardito.
query.result:
**English:**
97 Therefore stay where you are, for you are well punished; 98 and look well at the ill-gotten money 99 that made you bold against Charles.
**Cornish:**
97 Rag henna seugh, rag te eus ben pynys; 98 ha gwylyow ben an moneta drog-kemeres 99 a wrug dhe'th vos ow bold a-der Charles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 E se non fosse ch’ancor lo mi vieta 101 la reverenza de le somme chiavi 102 che tu tenesti ne la vita lieta,
103 io userei parole ancor più gravi; 104 ché la vostra avarizia il mondo attrista, 105 calcando i buoni e sollevando i pravi.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And if it were not that the reverence for the supreme keys 101 that you held in your happy life still forbids me,
102 I would use even graver words; 103 for your avarice saddens the world, 104 trampling on the good and exalting the wicked.
**Cornish:**
100 Ha na vo henna bos owth ow lettya 101 an reverens a'n allwedhow ughella 102 a dheuthas yn-mes dha byw lieta,
103 ow kov usya gerow moy grev; 104 rag dha avaris a wra an bys trist, 105 ow kalga an dhas ha ow sevel an drok.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Fatto v’avete dio d’oro e d’argento; 113 e che altro è da voi a l’idolatre, 114 se non ch’elli uno, e voi ne orate cento?
115 Ahi, Costantin, di quanto mal fu matre, 116 non la tua conversion, ma quella dote 117 che da te prese il primo ricco patre!».
query.result:
**English:**
112 You have made yourselves gods of gold and silver; 113 and what else is there to distinguish you from idolaters, 114 except that they worship one, and you a hundred?
115 Ah, Constantine, of how much evil was the mother, 116 not your conversion, but that dowry 117 that the first rich pope received from you!
**Cornish:**
112 Gwrewgh a wra hwagas dew dhur hag arghans; 113 ha pyth yw genowgh dheugh dhe'n idholutryon, 114 mes na wra onan, ha wheugh a wra kans?
115 Ah, Kostentin, a ges ovel o'n drog, 116 nag eus conversyon, mes an dowrans 117 a gemeras an kynsa pab o'n golon!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 E mentr’ io li cantava cotai note, 119 o ira o coscïenza che ’l mordesse, 120 forte spingava con ambo le piote.
query.result:
**English:**
118 And while I sang such notes to them, 119 either anger or conscience that bit him, 120 he pushed hard with both his paws.
**Cornish:**
118 Ha pan vyn ow kanas henna noten, 119 po iras po kosciens a'y mordhas, 120 ev a spingas kalessa gans an dhew bowes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 I’ credo ben ch’al mio duca piacesse, 122 con sì contenta labbia sempre attese 123 lo suon de le parole vere espresse.
query.result:
**English:**
121 I believe that it pleased my guide, 122 with such a contented expression he always awaited 123 the sound of the true words expressed.
**Cornish:**
121 Kredaf vyth dhe'n duga'm ow plasa, 122 gans henna labow kontens sempel e attendas 123 an son a'n gerow gwir owth espressa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Però con ambo le braccia mi prese; 125 e poi che tutto su mi s’ebbe al petto, 126 rimontò per la via onde discese.
query.result:
**English:**
124 But he took me with both his arms; 125 and after he had me all to his chest, 126 he climbed back up the way he had come down.
**Cornish:**
124 Mes gans an dhew bowes ev a'm kemeras; 125 ha wosa wosa oll war'n ef a'm brest, 126 ev a'n eskas war'n an fordh owth tiskennas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Né si stancò d’avermi a sé distretto, 128 sì men portò sovra ’l colmo de l’arco 129 che dal quarto al quinto argine è tragetto.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Nor did he tire of having me close to him, 128 so he carried me over the summit of the arch 129 that is crossed from the fourth to the fifth embankment.
**Cornish:**
127 Ha nag esa ev stanka gans ow kavos dhe'n ef, 128 hemma a'm portas war'n ughella an ark, 129 a wra treusys a'n peswara bympes dhe'n pympa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Quivi soavemente spuose il carco, 131 soave per lo scoglio sconcio ed erto 132 che sarebbe a le capre duro varco.
query.result:
**English:**
130 There he gently set down his burden, 131 gently because of the rough and steep cliff 132 that would be a hard crossing even for goats.
**Cornish:**
130 Eno ow spuas an karga yn sovel, 131 sovel rag an kleger sconk ha ughel, 132 a vydh dhe'n gavras fordh kalessa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Indi un altro vallon mi fu scoperto.
query.result:
**English:**
133 Then another valley was revealed to me.
**Cornish:**
133 Wosa henna, unn val aral a veu dhiskwedhys dhe'm.
